      • bounce

        private void bounce(Ray parentRay,
                    int n)
        Calculates the interaction of a given parent ray (which are the initial rays emerging from the waveguide) for a given number of times Adds the resulting (reflected) ray to the end of the parent ray's subsequent reflected rays. There is a 10% chance that the ray will be absorbed and ceases to propagate.
        Parameters:
        parentRay - The initial ray that all subsequent bounces are dependent on
        n - Number of intercepts (NOT bounces)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Required to call the reflect method and calculate the reflected vector

      • createBeam

        private void createBeam(javafx.geometry.Point3D iPos,
                        javafx.geometry.Point3D v,
                        double wgR)
        Adds an array of randomly created beams with a maximum possible divergence provided in the Constants interface. Determines the color of the parent ray and all of its subsequent reflected rays based on the parent rays starting location with respect to the center of the waveguide
        Parameters:
        iPos - Origin point of the beam
        v - Initial directional vector (as Point3D) that the beam is pointed
        waveGuideRadius - Half of the initial width of the beam emerging from the waveguide

      • ptsOnCircle

        private java.util.ArrayList<javafx.geometry.Point3D> ptsOnCircle(javafx.geometry.Point3D iPos,
                                                                 double radius)
        Given a circle's location and radius, return points along the perimeter with a random separation between 10 and 20 degrees
        Parameters:
        iPos - Center position of the circle
        radius - Radius of the circle
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of Point3D's located around the perimeter of the circle
